chargeHist.descr: Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas D. Madecky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to commence consecutive to Dane County Case 14CF1511.

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To pay restitution up to $10,000 payable to MLV, parents or their insurance provider to cover costs of counseling (Agent is required to provide documentation to Mr. Madecky to substantiate such costs and if there is dispute to documentation, Mr. Madecky would be entitled to a restitution hearing)
--To pay 10% restiution processing fee

--Psycho-sexual evaluation & follow-through with all treatment recommendations
--Sex offender registration and reporting
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--No unsupervised contact with minor children, except his children and his 1/2 brother Tyler
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No access to internet or computer device without Agent approval
--Maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--No Contact with MLV (dob: 4/3/98) or her immediate family members
--Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by DOC
--HIV testing pursuant to Wis Stats. 968.38(2) & (3)(c)

Arresting Agency: LMPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: Court's response: Sec. 973.046(1r), Wis Stats., requires the Court to impose the DNA surcharge on each and every conviction, regardless of whether DNA samples are taken and/or whether the surcharge has been imposed in other cases.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:38 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Lucas D. Madecky in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verfied; Statements by Stephanie D'Costa and Angela Villand, Sentencing arguments by Counsel; Statements by Nicholas Zindars, Tara Thomas, Meg Madecky & Lucas Madecky

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Madecky to 7 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4 years. This sentence is to commence consecutive to Dane County Case 14CF1511

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--Psycho-sexual evaluation & follow-through with all treatment recommendations
--Sex offender registration and reporting
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--No unsupervised contact with minor children, except his children and his 1/2 brother Tyler
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution up to $10,000 payable to MLV, parents or their insurance provider to cover costs of counseling (Agent is required to provide documentation to Mr. Madecky to substantiate such costs and if there is dispute to documentation, Mr. Madecky would be entitled to a restitution hearing)
--No access to internet or computer device without Agent approval
--Maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--To pay 10% restiution processing fee
--No Contact with MLV (dob: 4/3/98) or her immediate family members
--Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by DOC
--HIV testing pursuant to Wis Stats. 968.38(2) & (3)(c)

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

case called at 11:24am. 
Defendant Lucas D. Madecky in court with Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Mr. Madecky guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On agreement of the parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3. 

On request of both parties, the Court orders a Pre-Sentence Investigation; the report is to be filed within sixty days.
The Court refers the case to Branch III/Judge Wambach for the scheduling of a sentencing hearing.
The Court instructs the Court Reporter to prepare a transcript.
Attorney Lavoy voices the Defense intent to request substitution of Branch III. 
Mr. Madecky indicates that the Highway 59, Palmyra address remains current. 
recess 11:30am 

NEXT:  (1) PSI Ordered  (2) schedule Sentencing in Branch III in approximately mid to late February (Defense has indicated that a substitution-request is intended)
Jury trial on December 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on December 1, 2014 at 11:00 am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 2:07pm. 
Defendant Lucas D. Madecky in court with Attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case was scheduled for Plea & Sentencing today, however Attorney Lavoy requests adjournment for 45 days.  Attorney Lavoy explains that Mr. Madecky has been charged in Dane County in a case regarding the same alleged victim and the same course of conduct; Mr. Madecky was bound over for trial in the Dane County case yesterday.  Attorney Lavoy and ADA Teuber are discussing a global agreement involving the cases.
The Court adjourns, however the Court indicates that it is scheduling the case for trial again at this time. 
recess 2:11pm.

case called at 8:31am. 
Attorney Jonathan A LaVoy in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Both court staff and Attorney LaVoy received telephone calls from Defendant Lucas Madecky this morning indicating that he is having car trouble and it unable to appear.
Counsel indicate that they are in the process of exchanging discovery. Attorney LaVoy indicates that Mr. Madecky is undergoing evaluations. Counsel request approximately 45 days to continue discovery and further negotiate the case.
ADA Teuber indicates that the victim's mother is present in the courtroom.  The victim's mother indicates that she would like to have the case set for trial at this point.
ADA Hall estimates needing a two day trial length. 
The Court indicates that the case will be set for trial.
recess 8:33am. 

NEXT:  schedule FSSC and two-day length Jury Trial during the month of June (avoid June 9-13th due to ADA Teuber's schedule conflict)

Case called at 1:22 pm
Defendant Lucas D. Madecky in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant indicates that his DOB should be 2/7/1990 not 2/2/1990.
Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint advises the Court that appears to be an error, DOB should be 2/7/1990.
Court corrects by it's opwn hand the criminal complaint to show DOB for defendant of 2/7/1990.
Court verifies with the Defendant that the address listed on the criminal complaint is correct.
Court and defendant discuss the that Sue Madecky was an aquaintance of the Court's former significant other.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court reviewed criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1-#3.
Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint informs the Court that the descriptors of the defendant should be Hair color should be Brown and Eye color Hazel.
No objection by Attorney De La Rosa.
Court amends criminal complaint to reflect Hair: Brown  Eyes: Hazel
Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint informs the Court that height should be 5' 10" and weight of 160 lbs.
No objection by Attorney De La Rosa.
Court by it's own hand amends the criminal complaint to reflect heght: 5' 10" and weight: 160 lbs.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $50,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No direct or indirect contact with MLV or AV
-No presence on the street of the residence where MLV lives
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Tara Thomas
-No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 years except his own biological child
-Defendant must appear at the 3/17/14 Preliminary Hearing.

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit. (requested by the State)

Recess: 1:35 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 3/17/14 at 8:30 am
